author: Jenny Gross
title: Russia Poisoned Sergei Skripal? Not All Britons Agree
text:
SALISBURY, England—Just a few weeks before he was poisoned, former Russian double agent Sergei Skripal criticized President Vladimir Putin over drinks at a local bar, according to a regular there. Rory Ghazvini said Mr. Skripal’s apparent lack of concern was just one reason to doubt whether Russia was responsible.
“He obviously felt safe enough to be able to talk about that in a public environment,” said Mr. Ghazvini, a 32-year-old railway worker who says he overheard the comments at the Railway Social Club, where Mr. Skripal... RELATED VIDEO Russia, a Poisoned Spy and a Global War of Words The deepening rift between Moscow and the West is raising tensions to levels not seen since the Cold War. Following a coordinated response by Western allies, scores of Russian diplomats and intelligence officers have been expelled. WSJ's Niki Blasina explains the escalating situation.
